result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathon Mathais Vogel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office - 60 days to pay or setup payment plan.
Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250 surcharge.
May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

May not vote.
May not hold public office.
If not US citizen may face deportation.  
Absolute Sorbriety.

Mental Health Assessment.
Subject to random testing.

AODA and comply with recommendations.
Follow up with aftercare.

records.addlTxt: from DOC to Judge GaleWyrick re sentence.  Per Judge GaleWyrick - amend JOC to reflect 3 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES.
for Transcript Preparation by State-Employed Court Reporter.  Submitted by Staci Lundmark.
Sentencing Hearing - February 16, 2015

Defendant Johnathon Mathais Vogel in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Defendant Johnathon Mathais Vogel in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KK Clerk  11:29AM  14CF238, 14CF383.  Error in PSI pg one about length of Sentence.  Front page correct and the recommendation portion is wrong.  State and Atty Kempt both did not notice any other errors.  ADA Sortedahl goes over recommending sentence.  Atty Kemp goes over recommendation of sentence.  

Eligible for SA and Elig. for CIP.  Must not possess/use firearms.  May not vote.  May not hold public office.  May not possess/use body armor.  If not US citizen may face deportation.  

14CF238 (Count 1) - 5 years 6 months.  3yrs IC 2 yrs 6 mos ES.  AS, AODA and comply.  Follow up aftercare.  MH assessment.  Random testing.  $290.60 on each.  DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250 on one of the felonies.    

14CF383 (Count 1) - w/held.  2 yr probation consecutive to 14CF238.  

PCR.  adj.  11:53AM
To Judge from Probation Agent - regarding filing of PSI
From JA to Counsel - regarding PSI distribution.
Find PSI located in 14CF383.

CASES: 12CM402, 14CF238, 14CF383. Defendant Johnathon Mathais Vogel in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Defendant Johnathon Mathais Vogel in custody.  Daniel P. Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JB-clerk 4:00pm   State gives resolution. 14CF238 - GGP to CT 1 - DRI count 2; 14CF383 - GGP amended to misd battery with repeater - DRI count 2; Atty Kemp gives facts. PQWR. CT ORDERS: PSI, long form, agent not be present, PSI due by 02/02/2015, bonds continue. Must provide a DNA sample and surcharge, No voting, no firearms, no public office, no body armor, if not US citizen may be deported. 

12CM402 - Sentencing After Revocation -  CT FINDS: 143 days credit - time served with further understanding that it uses all of his sentence credit in all files - 143 days PCJ - TIME SERVED - $2,255.92 to Allen Timlin, $225.59 to PCDA (10% surcharge), $265.50 to COCC restitution to be reduced to CJ - PCR - adj 4:15pm  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
